item.title: Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Oversampling and undersampling in data analysis are techniques used to adjust the class distribution of a data set. Both oversampling and undersampling involve introducing a bias to select more samples from one class than from another, to compensate for an imbalance that is either already present in the data. Data Imbalance can be of the following types: Under-representation of a class in one or more important predictor variables.
